entries.title: Elon Musk’s Twitter is working on a ‘high’-risk paid video feature
entries.description: Twitter's first new feature under Elon Musk could be one that lets video creators charge users for access to videos. It comes with some big pitfalls.

entries.title: U.S. exploring whether it has authority to review Musk’s Twitter deal
entries.description: Terms of the deal give large foreign investors access to confidential information about the social media platform.

entries.title: ‘Permacrisis’ is a dictionary’s word of the year in ‘truly awful’ 2022
entries.description: The U.K.-based Collins's Dictionary names "permacrisis,” an extended period of instability, as its word of the year amid the Ukraine war and rising inflation.

entries.title: ‘Saturnalia’ is a morbid jigsaw puzzle that’s more clever than scary
entries.description: "Saturnalia," released Oct. 27, is stylish — but let down by its survival horror elements.

entries.title: MAGA porn, hate for Trump: China-based accounts stoke division
entries.description: Twitter disrupted three separate China-based operations that were seeking to influence U.S. politics ahead of the 2022 midterms.

entries.title: Musk mulls Twitter verification charge, barters with Stephen King on fee
entries.description: "We need to pay the bills somehow," Elon Musk tweeted after reports Twitter was considering a $20 charge for people to keep their coveted blue checks.

entries.title: Twitter wants to charge for verification. Here’s what you need to know.
entries.description: Elon Musk wants to charge Twitter users for verification. Here's what that means for people who have the blue checkmark, and those who want it.
